text: Expression of erythroid - specific genes in megakaryoblastic disorders .

Currently available data indicate that erythroid and megakaryocytic differentiation pathways are closely related to each other , and there may exist progenitor cells common to those two lineages may exist .

Acute megakaryoblastic leukemia ( AML-M7 ) and transient myeloproliferative disorder in Down 's syndrome ( TMD ) are characterized by rapid growth of abnormal blast cells which express megakaryocytic markers .

These blast cells express lineage - specific transcription factors such as <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> common to these lineages and frequently express erythroid - specific mRNAs such as gamma-globin and <extra_id_0> erythroid delta-aminolevulinate synthase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ALAS-E <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , indicating that most of the blasts in M7 and TMD cases have erythroid and megakaryocytic phenotypes .

text: These results suggest that blasts in M7 and TMD may correspond to progenitors of both erythroid and megakaryocytic lineages .
